Key Match Events: Kieffer Moore pounced on the ball in the box and lashed home off the post with only 38 seconds on the clock
Harry Wilson thumped a long-range strike into the net to give Wales a two-goal lead
Driton Camaj eventually pulled one back in the second half, but it was too little, too late
Karl Darlow made a brilliant point-blank save to deny captain Jovetic a couple of yards out
Ben Davies got back on the line to clear away the rebound
Pre-Game Insights: Craig Bellamy’s side secured opening draw with Turkey as Montenegro lost 2-0 to Iceland
Team news: Wales make five changes as teenager Lewis Koumas starts in attack
Wales XI: Darlow; Mepham, Rodon, Davies; Roberts, Cooper, Ampadu, N.Williams; H.Wilson, Moore, Koumas
Post-Match Reflections: The game played out in driving rain as a soaked manager, Craig Bellamy, watched his new-look side continue their more aggressive, front-foot approach
And it paid off as they added to an initial draw with Turkey in Cardiff last week with three valuable points here
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in driving rain
Craig Bellamy’s bomber jacket did not appear to be faring well
Craig Bellamy’s blueprint in a nutshell: high pace and hard running, and it’s working so far here
Others: Connor Roberts was forced off with what looks like a minor muscle injury
Stefan Jovetic had headered the ball on target and it may have been going inside the far post, before it struck the arm of Ben Davies
The referee – Georgi Kabakov of Bulgaria – waved away the protests
